1: On the holy mountain stands the city founded by the Lord.
2: He loves the city of Jerusalem more than any other city in Israel.[a]
3: O city of God, what glorious things are said of you! Interlude
4: I will count Egypt[b] and Babylon among those who know me— also Philistia and Tyre, and even distant Ethiopia.[c] They have all become citizens of Jerusalem!
5: Regarding Jerusalem[d] it will be said, “Everyone enjoys the rights of citizenship there.” And the Most High will personally bless this city.
6: When the Lord registers the nations, he will say, “They have all become citizens of Jerusalem.” Interlude
7: The people will play flutes[e] and sing, “The source of my life springs from Jerusalem!”
